name: Holiday Inn Ocean City

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed July 2009, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: My husband and I stayed here last summer before we went on our honeymoon in Greece. We just drove down from Philly, to get a mini pre honeymoon break and we didn't have any idea where we were going to stay, however my husband had mention he saw this Holiday Inn on Trip Advisor and it had great reviews.
reviews.title: Ocean City Favorite

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed January 2010, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: So we just walked in and ask for a room on the spot and it was more than what we expected. They gave us a suite and it was clean, roomy, comfortable, modern and fantastic view of the beach.
reviews.title: Excellant Experience

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed October 2009, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The hotel is in the middle of everything and right on the beach. It has its' own private pool if you choose to stay off the beach.
reviews.title: Great Stay!!
Nice - here's some hopefully helpful hints
reviews.text: We are definitely staying again.

I planned a kidnap for my husband & I to Ocean City, MD. Stayed at the Holiday Inn on 17th Street and glad we did. The room was spacious, well maintained and beautiful. The ocean view was spectacular! Indoor pool was warm and very clean. Love that the bar was open 365 days a year. Sometimes hotels will cut corners and close the bar for the winter months. Not at this Holiday Inn, everything was top notch!! Delicious Cuban sandwich and gin & tonic for lunch! MMMmm!! Staff was exceptional! Everyone spoke and was so willing to help. By far the nicest Holiday Inn I have ever stayed at. I highly recommend this hotel to anyone looking for a vacation or weekend kidnap for your spouse! We will definately be going back in season to enjoy the beautiful beaches and sites of Ocean City.
reviews.title: Beautiful
Great accomodations (for O.C.) right in the middle of everything.
reviews.text: In Ocean City terms, this is a five star hotel. Clean rooms in good repair, 2 outside and one inside pool. Bars and waitresses at the pools so you can have a cocktail and watch the kids in the pool. Been staying there ever since it was built. A little pricey compared to other places on the boards, but worth it.
Spacious rooms, great location, top notch service, no complaints, will stay again.
reviews.title: Outstanding

reviews.text: We had an outstanding stay at this hotel earlier this week. It is the nicest Holiday Inn that I have ever stayed at and is, in my opinion, the best hotel on the boardwalk. The staff members are friendly and helpful. The hotel is clean and still looks new even though it's been open since spring 2001. It is certainly an improvement over the two motels that were here before (Sandyhill and Ocean Park). There are two large outdoor pools and an indoor pool. We liked the heated activity pool. They also have a fitness center which we did not get to use. On almost every floor there are washers, dryers, vending machines, and ice machines.
reviews.title: Best on the boardwalk

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed September 2009, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We got to the hotel around 11 AM Monday and our room wasn't quite ready yet. Brian, the manager on duty, took our cell phone number and called us when the room was ready. The room that we were assigned (120) was very spacious and really nice. The living room has an L-shaped sofa and a huge TV. The bedroom has two queen beds and a whirlpool tub. However, this particular room overlooks the hot tub and activity pool, which we did not like. There is no view of the ocean and the balcony is not private at all. We went back to the front desk and Brian gave us the keys to two other corner rooms to check out (1116 and 805). We chose room 805, which was nice. It has a sofa bed in the living room and the bedroom had a king bed and whirlpool tub. The bathroom has a large shower with 3 showerheads, which was awesome! The room also has a kitchen and a private balcony with a table and four chairs.
reviews.title: Very nice, but not perfect
Would definitely stay there again
reviews.text: This Holiday Inn has not been "relaunched" yet, but will probably be once the renovations at the adjacent Quality Inn are completed (both hotels are owned by the Harrison Group).

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed September 2009, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: This was the second time I've stayed at HI Suites. The first time did not impress me, but this time was much better. It was much cleaner with clean comfortable furniture, and very soft, comfortable furniture. We had a south facing room and it had excellent ocean and bay views, but was very noisy with street, boardwalk, and neighboring hotel noise.
reviews.title: Nice place

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed August 2009, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: So we didn't leave the patio door open at night.
reviews.title: Well, Hold on A Minute

reviews.text: There are some things that could be updated, but we would stay here again.
reviews.title: Great place for family fun!

reviews.text: This hotel is just okay. First, the good news. The hotel staff works with the energy of a 5-Star hotel to make your stay as pleasant as possible. The hotel is mostly clean; which is hard being located directly on the boardwalk/beach. However, this is a Holiday Inn and is not a luxury hotel. The hotel amenities, room fixtures/furniture, decor, comfort level is average. The food is standard Holiday Inn with a whole grain not to found anywhere on the property. If you are only looking for location then this is the right place. If you are looking for upscale comfort, keep looking.
reviews.title: Great hotel but it is expensive

reviews.text: My wife and children stayed here recently for two nights and had a wonderful experience! The kids pool was great and my wife and I were able to enjoy some time alone at the pool while they played.
reviews.title: Very nice place to stay ~ LOCATION IS GREAT!

reviews.text: Our extended family booked a few rooms here for a long weekend during peak season. The hotel itself is in a great location, right on the beach and near everything. The rooms have a living area with a sofa bed, then the kitchen and bathroom in the middle, then the bedroom area near the window with the view. We used one room as the meeting place to make meals/eat and hang out and there was plenty of space for everyone. We were right next to the kiddie pool, which was actually great because we could walk through an iron privacy gate to the pool, then back into the room the same way (no trip through the lobby in a soggy swimsuit). It was still private in the room and quiet when we needed to sleep (the pool opens at 9 a.,m. then closes at 6 p.m.). The kiddie pool is great for a wide variety of ages with 2 slides, a lazy river and a whirlpool. Lifeguards were placed in 2 spots to monitor the pool, so it was very safe. It was also nice to have the option to choose the pool or beach or both each day.
reviews.title: Overall a nice weekend

reviews.text: Our only complaints were: 1) we did have an issue with the cleanliness in one of the rooms. The tub had mildew in the jets. On bed looked as if it was re-made and never changed (we requested new and made them ourselves). The dishes, blender and dishwasher were all very dirty. Even the trash cans had stuck-on food and used tissues on the bottom. I actually bought cleaning products and cleaned the room myself before we could use it because houskeeping could not respond to our needs right away. And 2) the pool closes at 6 p.m. even during peak season when it is light out until almost 9 p.m. Again we stayed right next to the kiddie pool and even we thought it was way too early.
reviews.title: Good Choice

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed May 2009, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The hotel was beautiful. The outdoor pool areas (kiddie and regular) were a mirror image of the Hilton pool areas with the exception of the Hilton's swim-up pool bar. Great pool area for kids. Whoever put the hot tub (for adults only) in the back of the kiddie pool area was an idiot. Kids are all around it and want to go in it and the hot tub closes when the kiddie pool area closes. (During our stay, the kiddie area and the hot tub sometimes closed earlier than the stated times. We were asked to leave the hot tub early once during our stay.) Had to turn in cards to get towels. I don't know if they were also serving as lifeguards, but the two teenagers running the towel area were normally not at the "towel hut" and at times there was a sign saying that you had to go to the front hotel desk to get towels. Despite the sign, the front desk staff seem aggravated that they had to hand out towels. Otherwise, front desk staff was very courteous and helpful. Indoor pool area is nice but is located next to the restaurant with no walls between them. No hot tub or jacuzzi in indoor pool area.
reviews.title: Nice Place

reviews.text: Restaurant was very expensive, even for breakfast. I would recommend passing on the $20/day meal vouchers for $10/day and go eat somewhere else.
reviews.title: It's a great stay

reviews.text: The suites are beautiful as well. Room was very clean, including the tile livingroom. Rooms had a lot of nice little extras like flat screen TV's, ceiling fans, blender, and jacuzzi tub.
reviews.title: Sounds like it's all been said...so stay here

aka: Holiday Inn Hotels And Suites Ocean City Hotel
description: Luxury all-suite hotel located directly on the beach & boardwalk. Over-sized suites with separate living room, bedroom, and kitchens including residential size dishwasher, range, refrigerator, microwave, and tons of cabinet space filled with dishes, utensils, and cookware. Private balconies overlooking the ocean feature a dining table and chairs for four person. Elegant, large bathrooms with Jacuzzi tubs in every room. Elevated outdoor pool and expansive deck overlooking the beach. Four story atrium with indoor pool, open-air restaurant, fitness center, and game room. Meeting facilities. Guest laundry on every floor, free HBO & Disney channel, complimentary newspaper, coffee and fruit. Video tape players & computer data ports in every room.
